title: Anthony Horowitz: 'I feel the need to do the unexpected'
description: The prolific novelist's latest work is a mind-bending murder mystery to tie readers in knots.

title: CEO Secrets: The company that tried having two CEOs
description: Cybersecurity company Darktrace experimented with having two joint CEOs for four years.

title: Former swimmer Harry Needs on coming out as bisexual
description: Former swimmer Harry Needs says bisexuality isn't "a gateway to becoming gay" or "greedy".

title: Arctic National Wildlife Refuge: The animals at risk from Alaska oil drilling
description: As Donald Trump pushes forward with plans for drilling in the Alaskan wilderness, what is at stake?

title: 'We have had parents crying for us to open'
description: The children's activities sector says it has been hit hard by the coronavirus lockdown.

title: The king, his lover - and the elephant in the palace
description: Corinna zu Sayn-Wittgenstein speaks out about a multi-million euro gift from Spain's ex-king and an ill-fated elephant hunt.

title: US Election 2020: Kamala Harris targeted by false conspiracy theories
description: The Democratic vice-presidential nominee has been subjected to lots of false claims on social media.

title: Earliest art in the British Isles discovered on Jersey
description: Fragments of stone engraved with abstract designs are the earliest art in the British Isles.

title: Three Portsmouth island forts go on sale for £9m
description: Two of the forts off Portsmouth's coast have been converted into hotels, the other needs renovation.

title: Apple helped make 'top secret' iPod for US government
description: A former Apple engineer says the modified iPod secretly recorded data using hidden extra hardware inside.

title: Warwick nurse Isobel Corrie up for award after mid-flight CPR
description: Isobel Corrie was on a flight back from Thailand when James Birch had a cardiac arrest mid-flight.

title: Rail fares to rise 1.6% in January despite passenger slump
description: Passenger groups want fares overhaul after numbers collapse in lockdown. Scotland is delaying rises.

title: Manchester attack: Hashem Abedi refuses to leave cell
description: Hashem Abedi's sentencing hearing is told the "horrendous act of cowardice changed lives forever".

title: Berlin motorway crashes probed as terror attack
description: A man rams three motorbikes in what prosecutors say was an "Islamist-motivated" attack.

title: Coronavirus: Local lockdown in Aberdeen extended
description: Nicola Sturgeon says it is "not yet safe" to ease restrictions - but council leaders are opposed to the extension.

title: Channel crossings: Body of teenage migrant found on French beach
description: The 16-year-old from Sudan, whose body was found at Sangatte, Calais, reportedly went missing at sea.

title: Coronavirus: UK to ramp up coronavirus monitoring programme
description: More swabbing will reveal how many people in the general population are infected at any given time.

title: Northamptonshire Police officer gets stuck in handcuffs in training
description: Firefighters used pedal cutters to release the officer who walked to the fire station for help.

title: Phones could detect drinking over legal driving limit
description: By tracking how people walk, they were able to detect the owner's blood alcohol level.

title: Coronavirus: UK 'not considering' compulsory face masks in workplaces
description: The government is not looking at following France in enforcing office coverings, Matt Hancock says.

title: A-levels U-turn: Universities facing 'crazy demand' from students
description: Thousands of students now have the A-level grades to get their first-choice course, but can universities still help them?

title: Britney Spears asks court to remove dad's control over personal life
description: The singer's father Jamie has acted as her legal conservator for 12 years.

title: Sajid Javid: Why has the ex-chancellor been allowed to work for JP Morgan?
description: The ex-chancellor has taken a job with the US bank, six months after resigning from government.

title: Hands-free driving could be made legal on UK roads by spring
description: Government is consulting industry on technology which can take control of a vehicle at up to 70mph.

title: Chris Froome & Geraint Thomas left out of Tour de France squad by Team Ineos
description: Chris Froome and Geraint Thomas are left out of Team Ineos' Tour de France squad.

title: Tiger King zoo permanently closes
description: Current owner Jeff Lowe announced the decision after "false accusations" were made against him.

title: Coronavirus: What's happening with university admissions?
description: The grading fiasco is a new headache for universities already reeling from coronavirus disruption.

title: Ronald Koeman: Barcelona name former player as new head coach
description: Former player Ronald Koeman is named Barcelona's new head coach two days after the club sacked Quique Setien.

title: Mauritius oil spill: Satellite images show removal operation
description: Satellite images capture tug boats trying to remove the broken vessel, which spilled tonnes of oil.

title: Formula 1: All teams sign up to sport's new Concorde Agreement
description: All 10 teams have signed up to the new Concorde Agreement which will govern Formula 1 from 2021 to 2025.

title: Naomi Osaka and Serena Williams top as tennis dominates rich list
description: The world's nine highest-earning sportswomen over the past year are all tennis players, according to US business magazine Forbes.

title: Dido Harding's meteoric rise from telecoms to test and trace, and beyond
description: Who is the former businesswoman and jockey chosen to head the UK's new public health agency?

title: Whitley Bay mask-exempt woman urges 'more understanding'
description: Louise Sharp says she is now afraid to leave the house after being abused while shopping.

title: Champions League: Pick your all-time XI from players in the tournament
description: Who do you think are the greatest XI players ever to play in the Champions League?

title: Fight Talk: Could Joshua-Whyte II happen next year?
description: Eddie Hearn says Dillian Whyte could fight Anthony Joshua if Tyson Fury vacates his WBC belt and Rachel Ball returns to the day job after beating Shannon Courtenay.

title: Black Lives Matter: Cardiff Uni racism row student seeks legal advice
description: The former Cardiff University student seeks legal advice over how it dealt with a racism complaint.

title: China record floods wet feet of Leshan Giant Buddha

title: Sports Team: The band that locked down together and took on Lady Gaga

title: Belarus on the brink: What now?
description: After 26 years under President Lukashenko people in Belarus are demanding change.
